ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Functional Neurological Disorder (FND) / Functional Audiogenic Seizures
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Seizures triggered by unexpected sounds rather than intensity; normal hearing thresholds; dissociative elements; symptoms inconsistent with organic pathology.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Hyperacusis
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Considered due to sound sensitivity and avoidance, but ruled out as triggers were not intensity-dependent and perception was not of overwhelming loudness.

ranked_differential_diagnosis.label: Epilepsy
ranked_differential_diagnosis.rationale_short: Ruled out by multidisciplinary team; seizures determined to be nonepileptic in nature.

ordered_list.rationale_short: Initial assessment including otoscopy and observation of seizure triggers; audiometry deferred due to safety.
Formal assessment of hearing thresholds performed once safety support was available.
Follow-up assessment of seizure frequency and impact of management changes.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Initial assessment revealed normal otoscopy but formal testing was deferred due to the risk of seizures. A seizure was observed in the clinic triggered by a whistle, characterized by muscle spasms and dissociation.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Otoscopy was normal. A seizure was triggered by a colleague whistling; pure-tone audiometry was deferred.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Formal audiometric testing was successfully performed and ruled out peripheral hearing loss, supporting a non-organic or functional etiology for the sound sensitivity.

tests.name: Pure-tone audiometry
tests.result_summary: All thresholds were found to be within normal limits.

expected_interpretations_by_visit.collective_interpretation: Follow-up after FND diagnosis and medication changes showed a significant reduction in seizure frequency, attributed to removing exacerbating factors.

tests.name: Other
tests.result_summary: Seizure frequency reduced to 2 in a 3-month period (previously daily).

proposed_items: Gradual, self-directed reduction of hearing protection
Discontinuation of nortriptyline and betahistine (coordinated with medical team)
counseling_actions: Explain that hearing tests confirm normal ear function ('hardware' is intact)
Discuss FND diagnosis as a 'software' or processing issue, not malingering
Advise that constant use of hearing protection reinforces the brain's threat response to sound
Validate that symptoms are real and distressing despite the lack of organic pathology

escalation.rationale_short: To confirm the diagnosis of nonepileptic seizures/FND and access specialized multidisciplinary management.

follow_up_plan.objective: Monitor seizure frequency and progress with reducing hearing protection.

expected_outcome: Patient was seizure free for the prior 6 months
Use of hearing protection was now exceptional rather than routine
